title: A person starts driving and travels 3 km east to a store. The person then turns around and travels 1 km west to another store. Finally, the person travels 2 km west back to the starting point. What distance has this person traveled? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends…..! Person starts driving and travels 3 km east to a store. Distance travelled = 3 km The person then turns around and travels 1 km west to another store Distance travelled = 1 km. Finally, the person travels 2 km west back to the starting point. Distance travelled = 2 km. What distance has this person traveled? Total distance travelled by the person in car = 3 km + 1 km + 2 km. = 6 km. The person travelled in car the distance of 6 km Answer: The person travelled in car, the distance of 6 km

You could probably have added up the numbers yourself in less time than it took to copy/paste this homework into Quora. If you can’t add up three whole numbers of three and under, you really should pay more attention in school, because right now, you’re looking kind of thick for posting that.
